definition: to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The full employment is an extrusive problem in the world today.
sentences.chinese: 充分就業是當今世界面臨的一個突出問題。

sentences.english: This would be a very good start for getting the economy back toward full employment.
sentences.chinese: 這是讓經濟轉向充分就業的良好開端。

sentences.english: Second, implement the strategy of full employment.
sentences.chinese: 第二，實施充分就業的發展戰略。

sentences.english: We still have one-in-six Americans either unemployed or underemployed.
sentences.chinese: 我們還有六分之一的美國人失業或未充分就業。

sentences.english: Full-employment and sustainable development are the two targets of the technical innovation.
sentences.chinese: 充分就業和可持續發展是經濟學所兼顧的兩大目標。

definition: see 每況愈下|每况愈下[mei3 kuang4 yu4 xia4]
